intro: Xiphion vulgare var. serotinum, commonly known as the late-flowering bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant blooms in late summer to early autumn, making it a notable addition to gardens during the transitional seasons. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, thriving in Mediterranean climates. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting flowers and compact growth habit.
